programme.title: Trap Finals - Shooting | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 29/07/2021 at the Asaka Shooting Range, Tokyo. Rehak Stefecekova (SVK) claimed the Gold in the Women's Trap and Liptak (CZE) in the Men's Trap competiton.

programme.title: Viktoriia: Ukraine’s Gymnastics Hope
programme.desc: As the bombs dropped in her hometown of Kyiv and her father left home to fight in the war, Ukrainian rhythmic gymnast Viktoriia Onopriienko battled daily to make her dream – competing in Paris 2024 – come true. This documentary showcases her grit, resilience and determination in her inspiring journey to compete at the Olympic Games. Discover the indomitable spirit of this young athlete as she prepares to represent Ukraine on the world stage.

programme.title: HUN v ROC / SWE v FRA - Women's Preliminaries - Handball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 29/07/2021 at the Yoyogi National Stadium, Tokyo.

programme.title: Men's Individual Epee Final | Rio 2016 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Relive the greatest Olympic Moments from the Rio Summer Olympic Games in 2016 and watch as Park Sang-Young wins gold for the Republic of Korea in the men's individual epee final, and Geza Imre wins silver for Hungary

programme.title: Ezra: A high-jumper finds community and another chance | The Starting Line
programme.desc: As high-jump reigning World Champion, Ezra Frech prepares to return to the Paralympics for the second time. He reflects on his remarkable journey with his father and together with his mother, he takes us to meet their wider and beloved Californian community as they organize a unique event for adaptative sports in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Ferdinand: The Beast from the East returns to his roots | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Known as the ‘Fastest Man in Africa’ for his prowess in the 100m, Ferdinand Omanyala is setting his sights on becoming the fastest man in the world at Paris 2024. We follow him as he travels back to his hometown of Kitale in Kenya to get the blessings he needs from his peers and uncover the remarkable story of his origins.

programme.title: Women's Singles QFs & Mix Doubles Bronze Medal - Badminton | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Musashino Forest Sport Plaza, Tokyo. It includes Women's Singles Quarterfinals and the Mixed Doubles Bronze Medal Match, in which WATANABE Yuta and HIGASHINO Arisa (JPN) beat TANG Chun Man & TSE Ying Suet (HKG) to take the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Court 1: Mens Doubles Bronze Medal, Mixed Doubles Semi-Final - Tennis | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Ariake Tennis Park, Tokyo. It includes the Men's Doubles Bronze Medal Match Krajikec/Sandgreen (USA) v Daniell/Venus (NZL) with Daniell/Venus (NZL) claiming the medal and the Mixed Doubles Semifinals Pavlyuchenkova/Rublev (ROC) v Barty/Peers (AUS) & Vesnina/Karatsev (ROC) v Stojanovic/Djokovic (SRB)

programme.title: Teresa Portela Olympic longevity makes her a legend | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Marked by determination, Teresa Portela's journey unfolds over six Olympics. From Rio to Tokyo, Portela's pursuit of Olympic glory was balanced between being an elite athlete and the joys of motherhood. In Tokyo, she finally won a long-awaited medal by bringing home silver in the K-1 200 canoe sprint event. Now training for Paris 2024, she will become the first Spanish woman to compete in seven Olympic Games.

programme.title: Iris Tió is key to Spain’s next gold in Artistic Swimming | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Iris Tió Casas joined the senior national team at 15, living away from her parents most of the time. Four years later she competed in Tokyo where she was the youngest on the team. For Paris 2024, she will be crucial to the team’s chances, aiming for gold at Paris 2024. Her journey reflects immense dedication, resilience, and a dream realized through hard work. She will compete in the team as well as in the duet event with her partner Alissa Ozhogina.

programme.title: Helen Glover eyes Paris 2024 for her fourth Olympics | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: After winning back-to-back gold in London 2012 and Rio 2016, Helen Glover made a remarkable come-back in Tokyo 2020, being the first mother to row for Britain. She and partner Polly Swann finished fourth. Helen now has her sights on Paris 2024 where she should be competing in the Women's four event, focusing on adding another Olympic medal to her impressive career for Team GB.

programme.title: France's Sevens captain targets gold at Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Backed by a great team and high perfornming coaches, Carla's quest for Olympic gold symbolizes the rise of women's rugby since Rio 2016. From competing with boys to leading her nation to Silver in Tokyo 2020, the French rugby Seven squad’s captain inspires resilience and dedication on the road to Paris 2024.

programme.title: Niklas Kaul - medal contender for Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Despite an incredible 2019 season, winning gold at the World Championships and setting a world’s best record, decathlete Niklas Kaul from Germany faced challenges at Tokyo 2020 due to an injury sustained in the high jump event. After focusing on recovery and preparing for future competitions, he reached an impressive 4th place at the European Championships in Roma, which puts him back in a position to medal at Paris 2024.

programme.title: Leonardo Fabbri’s success is rooted in family support | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: From his early athletic beginnings to his emotional 22.34m throw, Leonardo's journey is marked by family support and a dream of Olympic success. Despite setbacks, his determination remains unshaken as he aims for glory at Paris 2024. The Tuscan shot putter won gold at the European Championships, setting a championship record and placing him as a serious contender for the coming games.

programme.title: Matteo Zurloni Italy’s world champion climbs to the top | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Dive into the remarkable journey of Matteo Zurloni, from small town dreamer to Olympic contender. He won the speed event at the 2023 IFSC Climbing World Championships and earning a shot at Olympic glory. Follow his ascent from humble beginnings to the dizzying heights of international competition, where every climb is a test of skill, courage, and the relentless pursuit of excellence.

programme.title: Norwegian duo are targeting back-to-back Olympic Gold | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Reigning World and Olympic Champions Christian Sørum and Anders Mol are dominating beach volleyball. Their partnership, rooted in a Viking mentality, has kept them atop the sport for six years. They are now preparing for a historic back-to-back Olympic gold at Paris 2024 to honour Christian's mother's legacy.

programme.title: Women's Long Jump Final - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 03/08/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo. Mihambo (GER) claimed the Gold, Reese (USA) Silver and Brume (NGR) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's Tennis Singles Final | Seoul 1988 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Relive one of the greatest Olympic Moments in tennis and join us at the Seoul Summer Olympic Games in 1988 as Steffi Graf wins gold for West Germany in the women's tennis singles final over Gabriela Sabatini from Argentina

programme.title: Men's Tennis Single Bronze Medal Match| Atlanta 1996 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Relive the greatest Olympic Moments and watch Leander Paes' men's tennis single bronze medal match from Atlanta 1996, as well as other best moments from his career. See more Leander Paes videos below.

programme.title: Ezra: A high-jumper finds community and another chance | The Starting Line
programme.desc: As high-jump reigning World Champion, Ezra Frech prepares to return to the Paralympics for the second time. He reflects on his remarkable journey with his father and together with his mother, he takes us to meet their wider and beloved Californian community as they organize a unique event for adaptative sports in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Ferdinand: The Beast from the East returns to his roots | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Known as the ‘Fastest Man in Africa’ for his prowess in the 100m, Ferdinand Omanyala is setting his sights on becoming the fastest man in the world at Paris 2024. We follow him as he travels back to his hometown of Kitale in Kenya to get the blessings he needs from his peers and uncover the remarkable story of his origins.

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Carlota: Proving herself and her sport to the world | The Starting Line
programme.desc: A young female breaker for France, Carlota Dudek is training to qualify for the Olympics to showcase her unique style to the world, inherited from her mother Cuban origin. We travel with her from Paris to her hometown in the heart of Provence where her life-long dance journey began.

programme.title: ESP v ARG - Men's Preliminaries - Basketball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This Preliminary Round Game took place on 29/07/2021 at the Saitama Super Arena, Saitama. Final score ESP 81:71 ARG.

programme.title: Trap Finals - Shooting | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 29/07/2021 at the Asaka Shooting Range, Tokyo. Rehak Stefecekova (SVK) claimed the Gold in the Women's Trap and Liptak (CZE) in the Men's Trap competiton.

Follow his ascent from humble beginnings to the dizzying heights of international competition, where every climb is a test of skill, courage, and the relentless pursuit of excellence.

programme.desc: Reigning World and Olympic Champions Christian Sørum and Anders Mol are dominating beach volleyball. Their partnership, rooted in a Viking mentality, has kept them atop the sport for six years. They are now preparing for a historic back-to-back Olympic gold at Paris 2024 to honour Christian's mother's legacy.

programme.title: Viktoriia: Ukraine’s Gymnastics Hope
programme.desc: As the bombs dropped in her hometown of Kyiv and her father left home to fight in the war, Ukrainian rhythmic gymnast Viktoriia Onopriienko battled daily to make her dream – competing in Paris 2024 – come true. This documentary showcases her grit, resilience and determination in her inspiring journey to compete at the Olympic Games. Discover the indomitable spirit of this young athlete as she prepares to represent Ukraine on the world stage.

programme.title: CAN v FRA - Women's Bronze Medal Match | London 2012 Replays
programme.desc: The women's Bronze Medal Match took place on 09/08/2012 at the City of Coventry Stadium, Coventry. Canada claimed the Bronze with a 1:0 win over France

programme.title: Men’s Football Final, Rio 2016
programme.desc: Two great football nations, Brazil and Germany, clashed in an epic gold medal final featuring Neymar against twins Lars and Sven Bender.

programme.title: ‘We’re the Best Team in New York City’ | We Are King
programme.desc: City soccer is very special in New-York City and MLK sits at the top, with 19 titles in 25 years. The team is off to a new season and gunning for its 20th title. Coach Jake and assistant Kamani welcome the team for their first practice and super-pro prospect Carlos Lainez is back from Spain. TThey will soon play the top Ohio State team. After a rough start, the team is taking shape but it’s a 16 match competition before the play-offs begin.

programme.title: ‘The Guy in the Mirror is Usually the One Stopping You’ | We Are King
programme.desc: Carlos Junior, the team captain and best pro prospect has 13 brothers and sisters, 4 are living with him and his dad in the Bronx. A semi-pro club in Spain offered him a contract but he made the promise to Jake and his MLK family to get them that 20th win. Maynor, also from Honduras, is taking care of his disabled mother. After a shaky start to the season, he comes into his own against Upper West Side rival Beacon.

programme.title: BRA v MEX - Men's Gold Medal Match | London 2012 Replays
programme.desc: The Men's Gold Medal Match took place on 11/08/2012 at the Wembley Stadium, London. Mexico claimed the Gold with a 2:1 win against Brazil

programme.title: AUS v USA - Women's Bronze Medal Match - Football | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 05/08/2021 at the Ibaraki Kashima Stadium, Kashima. The USA claimed the Bronze with a 4:3 win over Australia

programme.title: ‘Bacon, Egg and Cheese’ | We Are King
programme.desc: David Reyes Aka D. Dotty is a burly defender but he is juggling soccer and a burgeoning rap career with the need to help his family earn money in a tough Bronx neighbourhood. He often comes late or tired to the pitch. As the team moves up the rankings, Coach Jake is getting nervous and talks about his past troubles with addiction.

programme.title: ‘This is What We Live For’ | We Are King
programme.desc: MLK finally enters the playoffs. Three more games separate the team from their goal but their starting goalkeeper is now suspended. Assistant coach Kimani, both the kids’ chief on-field instructor and off-field confidant, manages to keep the team in balance. His patience combined with Jake’s drive are a perfect match. Defender Vakaba, who has come to New York City to fulfil his dream, joins the team and becomes an essential part of its success.

programme.title: ‘You Not Really about it’ | We Are King
programme.desc: MLK high school has been unstoppable this year. They are about to achieve an undefeated season. But Coach Jake is getting increasingly tense. While some players like Charles are doing great both at school and on the team, others like goalkeeper Raymond are struggling to keep their nerves, putting the whole team at risks. Raymond is trying to live up to the dreams and expectations of his father, a talented goalkeeper himself who never made it pro. Soon the team faces a decisive game which will determine the number one seed in the playoffs.

programme.title: ‘The Only Game that Matter is the Last One’ | We Are King
programme.desc: Can we tell a King player from another player just by his look?. A storybook season must end in storybook fashion. But as MLK is leading in semi-final, top player Carlos get a yellow card against their long-time rivals Beacon. Jake's obsession is now turning into superstition as he makes a final call that will soon turn the team fortune. Maynor, who had seemed to struggle in front of the goal since the start of the season, is proving to be a decisive striker.

programme.title: MEX v JPN - Men's Bronze Medal Match - Football | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 06/08/2021 at the Saitama Stadium, Saitama. Mexico claimed Bronze with a 3:1 victory against Japan

programme.title: Men’s Football Final, Atlanta 1996
programme.desc: Mighty football nation Argentina in an Olympic final against Nigeria hoping to become the first major football champion from Africa.

programme.title: BRA v ESP - Men's Gold Medal Match - Football | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 07/08/2021 at the International Stadium Yokohama, Yokohama. Brazil claimed Gold with a 2:1 victory after extra time against Spain.

programme.title: KOR v JPN - Men's Bronze Medal Match | London 2012 Replays
programme.desc: The Men's Bronze Medal Match took place on 10/08/2012 at the Millenium Stadium, Cardiff. South Korea claimed the Bronze medal with a 2:1 victory over Japan.

programme.title: Meet coach Matthew Booth
programme.desc: Meet Olympic hero and star coach of the Olympic Channel’s The Z Team, Matthew Booth.

programme.title: Can an Olympic legend turn around Hout Bay's football team?
programme.desc: Team South Africa Olympic footballing legend Matthew Booth tries to turn around the fortunes of a struggling local football team.
